overview:
A corporate lawyer by profession, Sunil has over twelve years of experience in Middle East, Asia and Europe. Over the past several years, Sunil has established himself as one of the expert advisers on construction and real property laws. He regularly contributes to leading law journals, magazines and newspapers on diverse subjects including lititgation and arbitration, property regulations, international tax, biotech and healthcare, money laundering, and so on

He advises on a wide variety of local and international clients, and Government(s) on a broad range of issues, including issues relating to merger and acquisition transactions (domestic as well as cross-border), construction and real estate, commercial litigation, capital markets and corporate finance advisory, and franchising.

He also advises main contractors, employers, subcontractors and suppliers in the construction, engineering and oil & gas sectors. He has advised clients in relation to many projects in the UAE, Kuwait, Qatar, Saudi Arabia, Bahrain and Oman.

Sunil is often engaged by clients as their “settlement counsel” for matters where existing consultants and representatives have been unable to extract them from cumbersome, expensive and complex arbitration/litigation.
